Dynamic.PrimaryImage.Common.ImageCaption: 210401 Pleasant View Commons - Exterior Images (Canton, OH) 1 - Copy

Common.Highlight.Common.Text: Established in 2016, Hall of Fame Village powered by Johnson Controls is a development of Hall of Fame Resort & Entertainment Company, and is a multi-use sports, entertainment and media destination centered around the Pro Football Hall of Fame’s campus in Canton, Ohio.
Hall of Fame Village powered by Johnson Controls attracted over 2 Million visitors in 2019 with projections expected to remain at or above that level moving forward

Outdoor programming participation expected to drive over 200,000 additional visitors to the site in 2021 with substantial growth following Phase II completion of the retail and office components, Hilton Tapestry Hotel, and indoor waterpark.
Visibility through numerous onsite programming including Enshrinement Week Powered by Johnson Controls, NFL Alumni Academy, festivals, concerts, and events.
Adjacent to I-77 highway with 102,672 VPD (ODOT, 2019)
Akron-Canton Airport is under 8 miles away.
Belden Village Mall, downtown Canton, and Stark County Fairgrounds are all located 5 minutes away.

Located next to high traffic shopping center

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: RETAIL S PACE FOR LEASE FROM 2,000 - 28,000 SF

Common.SubdivisionName.Common.Text: 3,302 SF End Cap Retail Space Available

Common.SpaceDescription.Common.Text: End cap retail space next to AT&T and Goodwell.

Common.Highlight.Common.Text: High profile retail space available for lease at Foxboro Square, which is anchored by Goodwill, Royal Docks Brewing, McDonalds, AT&T & more!
Former 3,122 SF Dairy Queen with restaurant equipment
Opportunity for a +1 Acre Pad Site for build to suit or ground lease
Neighboring retailers and restaurants include McDonald’s, CVS, Buehler’s Fresh Foods, ACE Hardware, Starbucks, Swenson’s, Pizza Hut, Taco Bell, Sonic, Goodwill, Conrad’s, Key Bank and more!
High traffic area with combined counts of 55,455 VPD at the intersection (Source: ODOT)
Located across from the 55,000 SF Mercy Health Center and Jackson High School (2,041 enrollment) and Jackson Middle School (553 enrollment).
Located minutes from Belden Village retail corridor, one of Northeast OH’s strongest retail and restaurant corridors.
The area has strong average household incomes of $99,846 in a 3 mile radius
The 5 mile population is 101,361, which also features positive population growth in a 1,3 & 5 mile radius.
Monument signage available along Wales Avenue.
